pull.title: [Trivial] [logging] Rm extraneous cleansubver in serveral debug messages
pull.body:
We log the cleanSubVer as part of connect.  It is not uniquely more informative
 than any of the other data we have about a peer, often less.  It's also often
 long now as well.  There is no need to output it as part of mempoolrej,
 AcceptToMemoryPool, or pong entries.  Leaving it out makes our log entries
 more uniform and consistent.

events.body: @paveljanik OK, I was trying to avoid gratuitously breaking parser, but fair enough. Changed.

events.message:
[Trivial] [logging] Rm extraneous cleansubver in serveral debug messages.

We log the cleanSubVer as part of connect.  It is not uniquely more informative
 than any of the other data we have about a peer, often less.  It's also often
 long now as well.  There is no need to output it as part of mempoolrej,
 AcceptToMemoryPool, or pong entries.  Leaving it out makes our log entries
 more uniform and consistent.

events.body: Okay. Message shorter as requested by @laanwj

ut ACK

travis death in rpc tests is unrelated?

comments.body: Now that we're changing this message: can we shorten it even further? I introduced this, but as it appears quite often (when mempoolrej enabled), I'd prefer a shorter formulation. Maybe "was not accepted" is enough?
